Only their heads were intact. Kirsten Gillibrand said the findings only heighten her worry that Megrahi's release undermines the international struggle against terrorism. "Economic and trade interests should never take precedence over matters of justice," Kirsten Gillibrand ( D-N.Y.) said. If we're ever going to win the fight against international terrorism, the rule of law must hold strong. The White House declined to weigh in on the report specifically, saying only that it believes Megrahi should be behind bars. if you count Yahoo, and Eric Schmidt recently said in Davos that Facebook is not competition, that it has no intention of going into search. On its face, it seems like a very lopsided duopoly. From my perspective, competition is always a click away. If we don't do the right thing by our users, it takes one word in their browser bar to go to another search engine. We don't even know how the information seeking model will evolve. What you may not think of as competitive today, might very well become the new way of seeking information. "There might be a couple guys in a garage somewhere building the new way of seeking information."
